summary:
I am a Chartered Structural Engineer with 25 years post graduate experience, specializing in Structural Design, Engineering Management, Construction Management and Contract Management.

I have duel Dutch and South African Citizenship and gained extensive international experience working in Africa, the Middle East and Europe. My experience record includes industrial and commercial structures, offices buildings, tall buildings, sports facilities, airports, laboratories, hospitals, prisons, educational buildings and large scale materials handling structures. I particularly enjoy planning and building large deep basements and undergrounds structures.

I have served in senior management for all the organizations I have worked for and have a wealth of experience in managing  both small and corporate consulting business units and clients. 

My passion and reason for becoming an Engineer remain. I love figuring out how things work and how to design everything better and more efficiently. In my spare time I enjoy developing and writing software and devising new ways of building better.
With my knowledge of engineering basics and structural principals I understand most things I read and I am constantly learning.

I love interacting with people from various cultural backgrounds and enjoy teaching and sharing knowledge.

education.degree_name: National Higher Diploma in Civil Engineering. NHD Civ Eng

certifications.name: SAICE
certifications.authority: South African Institute of Civil Engineering

profile_positions.description: AECOM Established in South Africa in 2012. As part of their expansion drive I was offered a mass recruitment and project take over package of our company. We accepted and I joined AECOM South Africa in November 2012 as an Executive in the Building Engineering Business line. I started my career at AECOM in the Durban office as the Structural Practice Area lead for SA East. Within one year they promoted me to AECOM’s Structural lead for Africa. Within that same year I was relocated to Cape Town and given the additional responsibility as Building Engineering Lead for SA West which included all the Building Engineering Practice Areas including Architecture. In 2015 AECOM promoted me to Buildings and Places South Africa where I served as a Growth Lead in South Africa. I remained in touch with my first love as an Engineer and throughout acted as The Project Engineer on many of the projects being carried out by our Business Line. In November 2015 I took over the role as the Lead Project Engineering Manager for one of AECOM’s largest projects in South Africa. The Transnet Saldanha Iron ore Tippler 3 project. In 2016 Transnet requested AECOM to dedicate me on a full time basis on their project and I was deployed to site in Sladanha where I currently serve as the Project Engineering Manager on the FEL 4 project.
profile_positions.title: Senior Executive, Project Engineer, Civil & Structural

profile_positions.description: Settled back in South Africa I was presented with an opportunity to realize a life long ambition to establish my own Consulting Engineering Practice. In 2005 I established RIBICON CONSULTING GROUP where I served as the Managing Director until November 2012. We were blessed with both private, corporate and government clients with projects ranging from Schools, Hospitals, Prisons, Industrial and commercial projects. We were blessed with three offices throughout South Africa serving our Clients country wide. I served as Managing Director and Project Engineer responsible for new business development, financial management, project reviews, delivery excellence and maintaining client relationships.
profile_positions.title: Managing Director, Project Engineer, Civil & Structural

profile_positions.description: PDV appointed me in Dublin to act as their Project Engineer and Design Lead on T.J. OÇonner's Dundrum Town Center Development. This was a mammoth project with a super basement five stories underground and an office park and shopping center on top. I started this project in Dublin and traveled between South Africa and Ireland to coordinate the design process of the design team and deliver the design deliverables to the local site team in Dublin. This project facilitated my move from Dublin back to South Africa where I was also involved in other projects of which the major one was as the Lead Project Engineer on the Daimler Chrysler lifestyle center in Century City close to Cape Town.
profile_positions.title: Senior Structural Design Engineer

profile_positions.description: Design Lead and Project Engineer for PHMCC on the State and Agricultural Laboratories project. I managed the Structural Design Team during the design phase of the project up to the appointment of the Contractor. This design phase duration was 18 months. This was followed by an eighteen month construction period during which I was responsible for managing the site resident engineering team on the project. We were responsible for answering requests for information, resolving technical queries and approving method statements. Further we were responsible  for all the inspections and signing off on the structural components of the project.
profile_positions.title: Structural Engineer

profile_positions.description:
I was privileged to work  here as a Structural Design Engineer. My duties included  running projects as Project Engineer and Lead Design Engineer. I was also responsible for  construction monitoring and supervision. The projects I was involved in ranged from prisons, educational facilities to water retaining structures and specialist repair projects on reservoirs.
My time here was cut short when I was presented with an opportunity to work in Europe and gain more international experience.
profile_positions.title: Senior Structural Design Engineer

profile_positions.description: I started here as a student Technician and progressed to a fully registered Professional Structural Engineer with the Engineering Council of South Africa (ECSA) working on various structural projects. My experience here started as a Student and ended as a Structural Design Engineer responsible for delivering on designs and documentation for various civil and structural engineering construction projects. One of my highlights was winning the Construction World award in 1995 for Excellence in Engineering Design on a project Whale Street Chambers in Cape Town. This was a complex of three eleven story office buildings in the center of Cape Town. During my time here I was also privileged to be seconded to a Consulting Architectural Engineering company in Doha Qatar where I obtained valuable international experience working as a Design Engineer with very experienced Structural Engineers on three tall buildings in West Bay Doha.
profile_positions.title: Structural Design Engineer
